meanings.definition: Unleavened bread traditionally eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, we always enjoy the matza with our family.
meanings.sent2: The matza was a key part of the Passover meal.
meanings.sent3: I tried to juggle the matza but ended up dropping it everywhere!
meanings.sent4: The matza was as flat as a pancake.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked matza filled the room.

meanings.definition: A thin, crisp cracker made of flour and water.
meanings.sent1: I like to spread cream cheese on my matza for a snack.
meanings.sent2: The matza cracker was perfect for dipping in soup.
meanings.sent3: I pretended the matza cracker was a tiny surfboard for my toy figurine.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as crisp and light as a piece of matza.
meanings.sent5: The crunch of the matza echoed in the quiet room.
